title: Firefox Browser Puts Me Four Hours Ahead
content: I plan content for a job that I have, and lately when going to these planning sites, my content will often post much earlier than scheduled. This is because though I may put, for example, 4:45 PM, the website seems to think that I am in a different time zone, posting at 12:45 instead. This has been across multiple sites, and I have been unable to fix it. Using other browsers, I don't run into this issue, and have checked my time zone on my computer as well to ensure that there's nothing wrong on my end. I've updated my browser, and even uninstalled and reinstalled, with no luck in correcting this error. Is there a way to fix this so it reflects my actual time zone?
creator: violetta0705

title: Saved Login popup missing letters
content:
I am having an odd issue where the Saved Logins pop-up is missing letters the first time I open a website. Once I mouse over the menu, the letters appear and do not disappear until the next time I open Firefox. It happens once per site per Firefox opening. This issue coincided with a slow performance and keyboard issue (laptop, keypresses reppppppeating). I sent it back to the manufacturer for repair, and they did a full Win10 reinstall. Fresh install of Firefox, and the issue is back. It does not happen Chrome or Edge. I have checked on my other devices and they do not have this problem.

Anyone else have this problem? Could it be a profile issue, or something with Sync? If it's just a quirk, I can live with it but I am concerned that the root issue that caused the slowness and keybbboard problem has not been solved and this is proof.

title: Video streaming issues/questions as it relates to Tabs(HBO Max)
content:
when using HBO Max Streaming service with Firefox, latest Stable, that you must have whichever tab/window playing the media be the primary active screen. Because when using PiP or switching to a different windows causes the media to lag and buffer. Playing only a few seconds. When you make that Tab the primary, it resumes normal uninterrupted playback. Why is this? 

I am assuming its something to do with the processing it takes to use HBO Max and when its not the primary it reduces resources from it for other things. Which is a huge bummer since PiP mode is useless in this situation.

To clarify, I only experience this with HBO Max. Other Streaming services work smoothly, even in PiP mode

title: Difficulty restoring corrupt .sqlite files.
content:
I installed the IDM addon and it caused my browser to revert back to an earlier version, thus corrupting my places and favicons files and causing me to lose five years worth of history. I have sqlite3 and I have tried seeking help from many different places, but I'm a neophyte when it comes to command line stuff and a lot of the information I have come across is either impertinent to those specific files, outdated, or has dead links. At this point, I'm willing to give the files to someone more tech savvy than I am so that they can fix them for me if I have to.

Please help me, either through instructions, or through direct repairs. If it's not possible, I can sync with my other devices and import six months worth of largely similar browsing history, but I'd rather it not come to that.

title: Gmail issue on Firefox "001 error"
content:
Hi,

I'm from desktop support in a company. We are currently facing an issue where Gmail randomly gives us the the Oops 001 error, it counts down from :59 seconds then resets after reaching 0:00 to 5:00 again.

We have tried clearing cache and cookies, restarting Firefox prefs, and reinstalling Firefox. In addition we have updated to the latest version. This issue is on Linux (CentOs 7.8), Windows and Mac.

We are not experiencing the same issue on Google chrome, it appears that it's only effecting Firefox when going to Gmail.

I would appreciate if you could give us some suggestions on how to fix it.

Regards, Sasan

title: Firefox 89 Hangs on Startup (even in Troubleshooting mode)
content:
I have a Windows 7 laptop and can run Firefox 88 just fine (even with several extensions). But installing Firefox 89 seems to trigger some hang on Firefox startup .. even in troubleshooting mode or with "Refresh Firefox"

It opens up into Firefox and brings up the first tab .. and then almost instantly locks up .. with just a spinning progress bar. Doesn't trigger any other crash reporters.

Even after waiting for 10 minutes, no progress and stuck forever. I have to eventually use Task Manager to force kill the Firefox processes. No crash logs are generated unfortunately..

If I revert back to Firefox 88, things work fine again .. so some interaction with the latest version. I've tried installing the latest build as well (89.0.2) but with same results..

title: 'change' event for geolocator permission not triggered on change through permissions dialog
content:
navigator.permissions.query({ 

      name: 'geolocation'

}).then(function(result) { 

      result.onchange = function() {          console.log('changed');       };

})

Using the above code, when the location permission dialog shows up in the browser and the value is changed from 'Block'/'Ask by default' to 'Allow', the 'onchange' function or the 'change' event aren't triggered. Essentially when this permission is set by the user using this dialog, I would like to show a message to the user asking them to enable their location to proceed, if blocked.

title: Facebook, Google probably cache problem
content:
Hello everyone! I`m using Firefox for a long time, but the following problem makes is almost impossible to us it anymore:

since a couple of month Facebook stopped working correctly on Firefox, it works for a while, then suddenly everything stopped, does not load anything, nor the page, nor messages... I need to clear the cache of facebook cookies then works for a while again... and then repeat.

It wasn`t a blocker problem with Facebook, but now it does the same with everything related to Google too. I push google button on bookmark, nothing, i push any button on Google (if already opened), nothing... Google docs buttons disappear, google login not works, etc... The same cookie cleaning helps, but i can not do this with google too... I`m logged in to work documents and stuff, can`t just reload everything every 10 minutes....

I use only Addblock Ultimate and Mouse Gestures Event, but tried disabling them without effect on my problem.

Thank you for your input!
